text: Would you like to do your presentation at this point? Hi, so I'm Harriet, I'm the manager at Cambridge Community House and I think quite a few know of the house. I've got a few familiar faces in front of me, which is awesome.  I'm gonna tell you a little bit about Cambridge Community House in case there's some things that you don't know. We run the only full wrap service for family and social services in Cambridge for our community. We've been running for 35 years. I've been lucky enough to be the manager for the last 18 months and have really seen a massive increase over that time itself in the number of people and families coming and seeking support from us.  So just had a look at the numbers, being a numbers person myself, I had a look at the numbers and we've actually doubled the number of people, families, the number of people coming and seeking support from Cambridge Community Houses actually doubled over the last four years. That's a huge increase. And yet our funding hasn't increased in line with that. So we're really kind of struggling to make sure that we've got enough funding to provide the services that we need to for Cambridge. And we're also expecting, obviously, population increasing to continue as well.  So we really stand for empowering our community by having a strong and connected community. We're all about, as I said, we have that full wrap service. We are the only one in Cambridge. And we also like to collaborate really strongly with other agencies in Cambridge, such as Salvation Army.  various other churches that run programmes, youth programmes and those kind of things. So, we really do like to tie in closely with other organisations in Cambridge to make sure that the community is getting what they need. So, if somebody comes to us and they need support, we'll see what services we can offer, but also look to the community as well. So, we're really working in tandem with everybody just to get the best for the family that are in need.  We do get some government funding for some of the contracts that we do, alcohol and drug work, we've got family violence, we've got general counselling as well as financial mentoring, but I have to say that the funding that we get from the government doesn't actually cover the salaries for the team, let alone all of the operational costs that go alongside that.  And tonight, I really did want to focus on our financial mentoring service, because that's a service that we use to really provide a lot of that wraparound service for clients. So, we'll have somebody come in, and they may have just been made redundant. Let's face it, we're really all seeing a lot of that happening now with COVID-19, and we're anticipating more once the government subsidy finishes this week and next week. So, we're expecting those numbers to increase.  But we use that service, instead of just providing a budget for somebody on a piece of paper and away they go, we actually walk alongside them. We call it a strength-based service, so we're actually giving them short-term support with, with other needs and that wrap, wrap support, so that might be food, furniture, household goods, bedding, clothing, you name it, we'll, we'll help them with that sort of short-term support, while we get them back on their feet financially. And what we're doing is we're walking alongside them, we're not fixing things for them, but we're walking with them,  talking to creditors and anybody else that we need to, like I said, alongside them so that they have a sense of, of control over their finances. They're learning and they're able to then stand on their feet financially and have that stability going forward. It's very much strength based in that we are, I won't say educating because it's not the right word, but we're enabling them to take control of their financial situation going forward. So, that's kind of what we do with that service and, and we don't get funded for all of the, the wraparound stuff that we do with that service.  And yet that's how we really empower people and see the magic and see the great results that we do. So we will continue to provide that service because it works. And so that's kind of what we're seeking funding for through the discretionary fund is to help us provide that service, to provide staff and my team with more hours to be able to see more people as they're certainly trickling in through the door at the moment. I'm expecting a big impact soon too with COVID-19.  Yeah, I just, I think that's probably all I really want to say at this moment, but there may all be questions and I'd love to hear them. Okay, thank you, Harriet.
